content.description: Let R be the region in the first quadrant bounded by the graphs of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mi>cos</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>π</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> <mn>4</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> </mrow> <mtext>and</mtext> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaahmart1ev3aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWG5bGaeyypa0JaaGinaiGacogacaGGVbGaai4Camaabmaapaqa a8qadaWcaaWdaeaapeGaeqiWdaNaamiEaaWdaeaapeGaaGinaaaaai aawIcacaGLPaaacaqGGaGaaeyyaiaab6gacaqGKbGaaeiiaiaadMha cqGH9aqpcaGGOaGaamiEaiabgkHiTiaaikdacaGGPaWdamaaCaaale qabaWdbiaaikdaaaaaaa@4C22@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, as shown in the figure above. The region R is the base of a solid. For the solid, each cross section perpendicular to the x-axis is an isosceles right triangle with a leg in region R.
content.question: What is the volume of the solid?

topic.text: 8.8: Volumes with Cross Sections - Triangles and Semicircles
